snippet: As the family of Armani Hankins, 16, struggled to understand the shooting, detectives were still piecing together how an outing in a fast-gentrifying corner of the borough turned deadly.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and EMILY PALMER

abstract: New York City police are still investigating shooting death of 16-year-old Armani Hankins in front of Applebee's restaurant in Brooklyn; officials blame easy availability of guns for incident, which also left another young man wounded.
lead_paragraph: As the family of Armani Hankins, 16, struggled to understand the shooting, detectives were still piecing together how an outing in a fast-gentrifying corner of the borough turned deadly.

headline.print_headline: Teenager Fatally Shot in Brooklyn Dreamed of Becoming a Lawyer, His Family Says
headline.main: Teenager Killed in Brooklyn Shooting Dreamed of Becoming a Lawyer, His Family Says
